channel.title: Homes on Seth W. Musser
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Seth W. Musser

item.description: Summary My goal as a physicist is to probe the role that topology plays in fundamental physics phenomena from the quantum Hall effect (QHE) to vortex dynamics in a superfluid. My broad interest in topology has often led me to interesting numerical work. For example, my interest in the topological aspects of superfluid vortex motion, as described by Scheeler et al., led to my work with the Irvine lab at UChicago.

item.title: Tutoring
item.description: I offer my tutoring services to both high school and college students and will gladly tutor a student on any subtopic of mathematics or physics. I worked for four years as a calculus tutor at UChicago so I have particular expertise there. Additionally, I am more than willing to offer test-taking advice for the: AP tests, SAT, SAT Math 2, SAT Physics, GRE, and GRE Physics. Finally, I can offer guidance on applying for nationally competitive fellowships and scholarships, having myself received the: Barry Goldwater Scholarship, Churchill Scholarship, and NSF Graduate Research Fellowship.
